fields.summary: describe table output always prints as if formatted keyword is specified

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Just go into the CLI and type "describe [TABLE_NAME]". If a comment has multiple lines, it is completely unreadable due to poor comment indenting. For example:
birthdayParam         string             1 = comment1
2 = comment2
3 = comment3

But it supposed to display as:
birthdayParam         string             1 = comment1
                                         2 = comment2
                                         3 = comment3

Comments should be indented the same amount on each line, i.e., if the comment starts at row k for the first line of the comment, it should be indented by k on line 2.
fields.summary: Comment indenting is broken for "describe" in CLI

comments.body: [~zhenxiao], can you submit a new patch at reviews.facebook.net (I mean, not a internal fb review, but a external review).

[~namit], A review request is submitted at:
https://reviews.facebook.net/D7173

[~namit], thanks for the comments. I addressed them and patch resubmitted at:
https://reviews.facebook.net/D7173

I am getting ~67 test failures. Most of them seem like test updates.
Can you update ?
Sure. Sorry, I did not run the whole testcases.

Updated and fixed the failing testcases, which fail due to the result format change of "describe TABLE_NAME".
Review request submitted at:
https://reviews.facebook.net/D7173
Tests succeeded with the new patch

Integrated in Hive-trunk-h0.21 #1842 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/1842/])
    HIVE-3140 Comment indenting is broken for "describe" in CLI
(Zhenxiao Luo via namit) (Revision 1418405)

     Result = FAILURE
